Description: 14 beads in different shape and colour: A: Four cylindrical segmented beads made of turquoise faience, preserved in different lengths. B: Two very thin disc-shaped beads, made of light green to turquoise faience. C: Six disc-shaped beads in a wider shape, four made of ostrich eggshell, two made of light turquoise faience. Three different sizes. D: One ring-bead made of dark blue glass, made from one filament with overlapping ends. E: One fragment of dark blue glass, no clear breaks, might just be a waste product?
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
